notesStmt.note: Much damaged. Some leaves stuck on modern paper.

Folios 1r, 316v: a note of ownership of the Karaite synagogue of Jerusalem. Daniel ben Mosheh ha-Melamed: inscribed, folio 1r.A note stating that certain Avraham Rofe used the manuscript in 5476 (1716): inscribed, folio 1r.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Volume 1 of Al-Murshid, the book of precepts of Samuel ben Moses ha-Maʿarabi.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental semi-cursive script of the 16th century. Daniel ben Mosheh ben Yeshayah Firuz: inscribed, folio 198v of volume 2.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Samuel ha-Rofe. Sefer Mitsvoth. Vol. I. Arabic. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2405.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), a antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Museum from him on 23 July 1881: inscribed (folio [318v]).
